model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I have a plan to never let the bride get married to anyone else. I'm going to steal her and hide her away.
What?! That's not right, Co-workers A. You can't just take someone away like that.
But I love her and I don't want her to be with anyone else. It's the only way.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Intervening in a Fight', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A shares the experience of breaking up a fight with Co-workers B, who commends their bravery and willingness to help others.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, guess what happened to me yesterday after work? ### Co-workers B: What happened? ### Co-workers A: I was walking to my car and I saw two women fighting. I ran over and pulled them apart. It was intense. ### Co-workers B: Wow, that's really brave of you to intervene like that. ### Co-workers A: It was scary, but I couldn't just stand there and watch them hurt each other. I'm just glad no one got seriously hurt. ### Co-workers B: Did you get the chance to talk to the police about what happened? ### Co-workers A: Yeah, they arrived soon after and took care of the situation. The women were grateful and thanked me for breaking up the fight. ### Co-workers B: That must have been a relief. It's good to see that there are still people like you who are willing to help out in those kinds of situations. ### Co-workers A: Thanks, I appreciate that. It's always important to look out for one another. Just like when you helped that customer resolve their issue last week. ### Co-workers B: Yeah, it's all about being there for each other, no matter what.' }
```
